comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.sberbank.com/ru/person/bank_cards/debit](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sberbank.com%2Fru%2Fperson%2Fbank_cards%2Fdebit) ### Comment > В Яндекс.Браузер или Google Chrome, открыть сайт сбербанка, при включённом AdGuard, сайт начнёт ругаться на сертификаты минцыфры, хотя они установлены, при обращении в сбербанк они говорят, что проблема локальная. issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [http://floebit.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Ffloebit.com%2F) ### Comment > I have already contacted customer support, and they advised me to fill out this form. The issue is that the domains in AdGuard DNS are not actually blocked; I can still access them even though they are marked as blocked. This applies to both newly registered domains and those that have been manually blocked and Parent control either. They appear as blocked in the dashboard, as shown in the attached screenshots. However, I can still access the sites even when they are indicated as blocked, which means that no domains are effectively being blocked. > This is clearly illustrated in a GitHub issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardDNS/issues/875 where a user has google.com on their blocklist, yet they can still access google.com, and the log shows it as blocked. The core problem is that no domains are being blocked, despite being displayed as such. > I have attached a screenshot of a newly registered domain, which is marked as "Newly Registered" in the log, yet I was still able to access it. Initially, a DNS developer closed the issue, but I believe there may have been a misunderstanding. So, I reached out to support again, and here I am. :) ### Screenshots

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@list-kr/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

comment.body:
@robw-nl Hi! This is not reproduced on my end.

> I have tried every filter combination (and none at all), did a reset, deleted all app/cache data, you name it.

As I see, it's not related to the filters.

> even though it's not filtered by adguard

That's strange, because in this case the app is not filtered by our app. Have you disabled it from the app management or global protection? If that's the case, it's best to file an issue [here](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardForAndroid/issues/).

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

AdGuard/uBO - Cookie Notices uBlock origin in Firefox 136.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.theguardian.com/uk

### Ad Blocking

EasyList

### Privacy

EasyPrivacy, Peter Lowe's Blocklist

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

AdGuard Cookie Notices filter

### Security

Online Malicious URL Blocklist

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

Description

Since Firefox update to 136.0 on mac today EasyList/uBO - Cookie Notices & AdGuard/uBO & Cookie Notices filter lists in uBlock Origin stop The Guardian web pages from scrolling - when switched off resets cookie acceptance and once accepted site works normally but not when either of these filters is switched back on

pull_request.title: Fix #200568 blog.csdn.net
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [X] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [X] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [X] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [X] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [X] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/200568

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

> Remove blog.csdn.net login popups

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Before:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->
![图片](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ef4b0208-4b69-4c72-9660-ca9f25c9bbe3)


</details>

<details>

<summary>After:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->
![图片](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0fcd9a2f-e18c-4ed5-a083-c093ec9e9eff)

</details>

### Terms

- [X] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [X] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [X] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [X] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [X] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [X] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/200568

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

> Remove blog.csdn.net login popups

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Before:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->
![图片](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ef4b0208-4b69-4c72-9660-ca9f25c9bbe3)


</details>

<details>

<summary>After:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->
![图片](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0fcd9a2f-e18c-4ed5-a083-c093ec9e9eff)

</details>

### Terms

- [X] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

### Issue URL (Annoyance) [http://google.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fgoogle.com) ### Comment > I have searched with google my entire life and since the accept cookies has become compulsory it is impossible to avoid the window. The only time it doesn’t show continuously if I am signed into my account but that cannot happen if I am using private or incognito mode. Usually previous unstructions help.

comment.body:
> AdGuard is no longer working via Safari with YouTube on mobile and it’s very frustrating.

I can't reproduce - I see ads only when turn off protection.

Please try to disable-enable content blockers in Safari settings and restart Safari, and check for filters update.
Do not close AdGuard window ~60 seconds, because iOS will break configuration process.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://nowebsite.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fnowebsite.com) ### Comment > The app My Dacia (https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.dacia.mydacia.one.fr) asks to accept cookies and requires to login after every reboot even though it's not filtered by adguard. If I disable adguard completely (no autostart) the problem is gone and My Dacia does not require any login, just starts as it should, even after a reboot. This can be reproduced each time so I expect this is fully related to adguard. > > This is a follow-up oer your request on a previous report (ticket ) which is now closed. Suggestion is that the filtering team takes a look at this. > > I have tried every filter combination (and none at all), did a reset, deleted all app/cache data, you name it. As soon as adguard runs the problem is back. As soon as adguard is uninstalled or disabled the problem is gone. Username: `@robw-nl` ### Screenshots

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://nowebsite.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fnowebsite.com) ### Comment > The app My Dacia (https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.dacia.mydacia.one.fr) asks to accept cookies and requires to login after every reboot even though it's not filtered by adguard. If I disable adguard completely (no autostart) the problem is gone and My Dacia does not require any login, just starts as it should, even after a reboot. This can be reproduced each time so I expect this is fully related to adguard. > > This is a follow-up oer your request on a previous report (ticket ) which is now closed. comment.body:
> Вы имеете ввиду URL в строке браузера?

Да. Ссылки, приведённые выше, имеют одинаковые параметры.

У меня c/без Адгарда или Ублока открывается один и тот же товар.

Скопируйте адрес товара на который хотите кликруть, откройте журнал фильтрации и перейдите по скопированной ссылке, и сделайте скриншот журнала (только Blocked)

issue.title: Просмотр контента 18+ без Google аккаунта в Firefox
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Можно ли в браузере Firefox смотреть видео с возрастными ограничениями без Google, используя расширение AdGuard? Скрипт Simple YouTube Age Restriction Bypass давно не работает. Какое пользовательское правило добавить?

### Proposed solution

Обход возрастных ограничений.

### Additional information

_No response_

Better add `$domain` to domain specific regexps. 
```suggestion
/^https:\/\/www\.natomanga\.com\/js\/[a-f0-9]{32}\.js$/$script,domain=natomanga.com
```

pull_request.title: Fix #200584 sky.pro
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

#200584

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met
